com.basho.riak.client.api.commands

Class ImmediateCoreFutureAdapter<T2,S2,T,S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.basho.riak.client.api.commands.ListenableFuture<T2,S2>
      • com.basho.riak.client.api.commands.CoreFutureAdapter<T2,S2,T,S>
        • com.basho.riak.client.api.commands.ImmediateCoreFutureAdapter<T2,S2,T,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The core response type.
    S - The core query info type.
    T2 - The converted response type.
    S2 - The converted query info type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    RiakFuture<T2,S2>, RiakFutureListener<T,S>, Future<T2>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImmediateCoreFutureAdapter.SameQueryInfo

    public abstract class ImmediateCoreFutureAdapter<T2,S2,T,S>
extends CoreFutureAdapter<T2,S2,T,S>
    Used when the converted response is available before the core future is complete.
    Since:
    2.1.0
    Author:
    Alex Moore

      • get

        public T2 get(long timeout,
              TimeUnit unit)
       throws InterruptedException,
              ExecutionException,
              TimeoutException
        Description copied from interface: RiakFuture
        Waits if necessary for at most the given time for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result, if available.

        Note that the timeout value here is how long you are willing to wait for this RiakFuture to complete. If you wish to set a timeout on the command itself, use the timeout() method provided in the command's associated builder.

        Specified by:
        get in interface RiakFuture<T2,S2>
        Specified by:
        get in interface Future<T2>
        Overrides:
        get in class CoreFutureAdapter<T2,S2,T,S>
        Parameters:
        timeout - the amount of time to wait before returning.
        unit - the unit of time.
        Returns:
        the response, or null if not completed or failed.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting.
        ExecutionException - if the computation threw an exception.
        TimeoutException - if the wait timed out.

      • getNow

        public T2 getNow()
        Description copied from interface: RiakFuture
        Return the result without blocking or throwing an exception. If the future is not yet done or has failed this will return null. As it is possible that a null value is used to mark the future as successful you also need to check if the future is really done with RiakFuture.isDone() and not rely on the returned null value.
        Specified by:
        getNow in interface RiakFuture<T2,S2>
        Overrides:
        getNow in class CoreFutureAdapter<T2,S2,T,S>
        Returns:
        The response, or null if the future is not yet completed or failed.
        See Also:
        RiakFuture.isDone(), RiakFuture.isSuccess()
